Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: asseltraeland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in that hotel in July, 2010 and I finally found some time to write the rewiew. It was one a nice stay, so I decided to share our experience. The hotel has a nice location. Short walking distance to the tube station (taxi in Barcelona is cheap if you don't want to take a tube). They offer a free SPA day and have the best SPA ever! It's better than in some 5 star hotels. The room was clean and comfortable. The only not so good thing about it: When we checked in I asked to change the room as the previous one was smelling like sigarettes. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: Catapaken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hesperia Sport Barcelona in July 2009...We were just talking about how nice our trip to Barcelona was...how perfect the hotel was and we realized that we never wrote a review. So here it is...The location of the hotel is just perfect! We loved the room! Cool decor, comfortable, clean, right size, nice balcony (no view to the Sagrada Familia but it was nice to sit down, have a beer and catch some evening breeze after a full day sightseeing). The best part of the room was definitely the bathroom! Great shower with body jets. I have to say that we did not use the pool or the gym. We didn’t even have time to go check them out. Last thing; I remembered that we paid a very reasonable rate for the hotel – Great deal! Totally happy! We recommend! Anyway, thanks for reading my note and good luck during your visit to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: Knolraab
Reviews.Content: This is a very good, clean, ultra modern, quiet hotel situated at a good location of the metropool Barcelona. Rooms are quite big and the dark wooden floor and the red wall really gives u a luxurious feeling. The bed is also very big and there a plenty of pillows to choose from. We had a good deal for 4 nights, inlcuding visiting the spa once, wich is located in the hotel as well. Tip: Ask for a room at the 4th floor. It can get noisy at 11.00 am when the gym starts ginving there lesson (something like spinning) so theru can hear loud music. At the 4th floor u can hear it as well, but very little compared to other floors. We will definitely come back again, when there's an offer again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location and Nice Ambient”
Reviews.Author: dear_nikolas
Reviews.Content: Nice touch with pillow menu. The bed is comfortable. The room design is so stylish which reflects the spirit of the hotel. However, if you need to sleep early or wake up late, try not to choose this hotel. Even at fourth floor, we can still hear the noise coming from its gym. Gym is started as early as 7am and ends late around 1030pm. So beware if your noise tolerance is low

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, city area not much going on”
Reviews.Author: bluefish1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, nice and modern. The hotel staff was very helpful and nice. They give you a one day pass to the spa, which is incredible. The area that the hotel is in, there's not much going on. The subway is very close to get to main attractions. The Sagrada Familia Church is beautiful and is a must see. It's not even a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and good location but lacking atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Copenhagen_Kabul
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room through hotels.com for 360 EUR for 4 nights. E-mailed the hotel in advance and requested a room on 5th floor to avoid noise. Was told none of the superior rooms are facing Sagrada Familia. Taxi from BCN T1 was approximately 30 EUR/30 minutes from the airport (Sunday afternoon) and 40 EUR opposite direction (Thursday morning). Receptionist informed us that due to low occupancy breakfast (14 EUR, I think) should be ordered the night before. We were allocated room 501 which was very large with 3 floor-to-ceiling windows looking down on the streets and were not asked to present a membership card to a sports club. Nice bathroom with toiletries, slippers, robes, shower and bath tub. However, the water pressure was very unreliable, especially the hot water. Two small flat screens, one facing the bed, the other facing the sofa. Large mini bar. Room was nice and spacious but there seems to be a general lack of attention to details such as no mini bar pricelist, no telephone list, coffee machine was not refilled and no overview of facilities. Free and fast wireless internet. Good location 5 mins walk from Sagrada Familia and sub-way station. Was given one day access to spa/gym per person. The gym/spa is nice but very busy and could be any other health club outside the hotel and is not really targeting hotel guests. Apart from access to the independent gym next door, the hotel has no facilities such as restaurant, room service, concierge, bar, etc. so do consider avoiding this property if you like to spend some time in your hotel and enjoy its facilities. Due to lack of facilities the property has no real atmosphere to it and should be seen more as an apartment hotel than a proper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice room, insupportable noise from the gym/spa”
Reviews.Author: cottagehome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a block from Sagrada Familia in a very safe neighborhood; cabs are cheap in Barcelona & you can get anywhere quickly from this hotel, on foot or by cab. We booked a superior room; it was very large, as was the bathroom. (There is no carpeting, so bring your slippers.) The shower was fabulous. Safe-in-room was very convenient, and there was room in the mini-bar for one's own supplies. The free wi-fi worked very well. The breakfast included in the rate was terrific. Now for the downside: everyday, Monday-Friday, there are spinning or pilates classes in the gym/spa which occupies the entire 2nd floor of the building. The music is skull-numbingly repetitive & deafening: if you are on the 3rd floor as we were, it's as if the exercisers are in the room with you. The floors & walls vibrate. The spa/gym belongs to a different company & the hotel staff (for whom I felt very sorry) have *no control* over what goes on in the gym: they begged the gym staff to turn down the music and they were ignored. I begged them too, in both Spanish & English, & I was ignored. Perhaps if you stayed on the top floor (5) or on the weekend (when there were no classes) you would not hear the music which on some days started at 11:00 AM and finished at 11:00 PM (it never finished earlier than 9:00 PM). If you read other reviews, this is a known problem & the hotel has to find a way to address it. (At first we were told there was a broken door in the spa/gym, but the music went on and on and on.)

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Zappy_ro
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed, relaxed, loved the atmosphere, furtinure, personell.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, however good service, beware of A/C, road noise, and the gym”
Reviews.Author: EOppie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first trip to Barcelona for business. I have to say that I had never heard of the Hesperia Hotel Chain before, and I normally stay at Starwood properties. Since this was closer to the office I would be working in, I figured I would give it a go. Check-in was easy, note that they do consider this an "athlete" residence...which I am far from. All they did was copy the scantag on my car-keys to my gym back in the USA. The Room was large, new and clean. I stayed in a superior sport room, which included a queen bed, and smallll working area divided by a half wall in the room. I was on the "4th" floor, which is the second floor rooms are on in the property. I did note that road noise outside was almost as if I had a window open, so I slept with the TV on. This was very surprising to me as this is a newer property, and I assumed that they would have better soundproofing in place. The bathroom was very well equipped with a nice welcome amenity kit (complementary) and a good supply of towels. It had both a showertub, as well as a shower. The water pressure was good, however the temperature fluctuated a bit from time to time as others have reported. Most of the staff is bi-lingual, and can speak some english. A note about the Metropolitan Club. You are given a single access to the club during your stay. I was here for over a week, only one access given. The hotel itself has no gym, no spa, no pool, and no rooftop deck. The pictures advertised on the Hesperia site are of the Metropolitan Club which is in the same building. This seemed a bit mis-leading to me. Also, remember to bring your European swimwear, which I was unaware was required. Speedo bottoms and swim caps required..otherwise people stare and point at you until you are drug out of the pool area and then a lot of gesturing occurs if you do not speak Spanish :-) I did not have the breakfast, however there are numerous bakeries and shops around. There are also two grocery stores directly around the corner to get snacks and drinks as well. The minibar in the room had space for my own water bottle, however it is not a fridge. It is only a "cooler box" with a light. The tap water was colder :-) You are less than 2min away from Sagrada Familia, which is actually a plus if you want to be boring and have KFC and McDonalds since it is a tourist area. However one helpful tip is the restaurants in the area are used to non-Spanish speaking people, so they will normally pickup you speak English and be able to communicate very quickly. The Air-Conditioning is not what I would call the best. My room was cool, however the unit seemed under-powered for the room. I will admit I like it cold, and I was there in August when all of Europe escapes to cooler climates, however don't think you can get the "arctic breeze" you can with other properties. The WiFi and wired Ethernet access worked well. Just make sure to ask for your code when you check-in. The business center is in the lobby, it consists of a canon pixmia printer, and a windows XP desktop. I traveled with my macbook pro, so I did not use it. When I needed to print something, the front desk was able to arrange it. I was unable to print from the room, however they said it was a known issue and they were working to fix it. They did not charge anything for me to print as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: seamonkey03
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was large and lovely-- it had the most amazing shower I've ever seen. Although it is located out of the city (it's a long walk to the water) it is literally a block away from La Sagrada Familia, which is always fun to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Hotel, Request a Higher Floor”
Reviews.Author: msbelgianian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July for 3 nights and were really impressed by the room's interiors for the price we paid. It had new fixtures and warm inviting colors. Internet is also included in the room rate. Just a few doors down, there's a supermarket to buy drink or snacks - nice convenience. I would recommend that you request a room on a higher floor. The hotel shares the building with a gym/spa, where they have fitness classes. On the 3rd floor, we could hear the class - music beat and dull voice of the instructor - in the afternoon and one morning. Hopefully, you won't have this problem if you're on the 4th or 5th floor. We also had the incident where the air conditioning system was dripping water into the room. They didn't have a maintenance person available to fix the problem at night and the hotel was completely booked, so we had to deal with the sound of dripping water. I did not have a very good night's worth of sleep. Not sure if something could have been done or maybe by then we were use to how things go in Spain. Most likely this was a one-off. On the plus side, Reception was very apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel... would visit again!”
Reviews.Author: LDNroamer
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. The room had views of the Sagrada Familia plus clean and comfortable rooms (amazing pillows!). Great shower. Staff were very helpful at all hours and the spa/gym next door (Metrolpolitan Club) is one of the best I have visited. Up to date machines and relaxing jacuzzis plus pool. There is a supermarket practically across the road for any little things you may need. Metro in very close proximity (2 stations in fact). I would recommend this place to friends and would most probably stay there again.
